titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company lease 1978.196
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-18T14:47-0500

did.unittitle: Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company lease
did.abstract: A lease of tracks to the Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company, dated 1881. The Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad was organized in 1876 and merged with the Coney Island Railroad in 1891. The Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad was organized in 1870 and foreclosed in 1887. Both companies were controlled by Loftis Wood at the time of the lease agreement.
